As of June 29 2024, [the Biden campaign's position](https://www.thedailybeast.com/biden-campaign-emphatic-he-will-not-drop-out-after-debate-disaster) is that Biden will not drop out of the race, and major Democratic Party figures including former president [Barack Obama](https://x.com/BarackObama/status/1806758633230709017) and current vice president [Kamala Harris have defended the president](https://www.newsweek.com/kamala-harris-defends-joe-biden-debate-1918553) on the basis that one poor showing in a debate does not negate the overall success of his first term.

On June 28, Biden acknowledged his poor performance in the debate, but [defended his re-election bid](https://www.telegraph.co.uk/us/politics/2024/06/28/democrats-urge-joe-biden-drop-out-election/):

>On Friday afternoon, Mr Biden insisted in a defiant speech in North Carolina he could still win the election but told supporters: “I know I’m not a young man…I don’t debate as well as I used to.

>“I give you my word as a Biden [that] I would not be running again if I didn’t believe with all my heart and soul I can do this job. Quite frankly, the stakes are too high.”

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of Joe Biden announcing he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination before July 15, 2024, we need to consider several factors: 1. Incumbent advantage: Historically, sitting presidents rarely decline to run for a second term unless faced with significant challenges or health issues. 2. Current status: As of now (July 2024), Biden is the presumptive Democratic nominee and has been campaigning for re-election. 3. Age and health concerns: Biden will be 81 at the start of a potential second term, making him the oldest president in U.S. history. This has raised concerns about his ability to serve effectively. 4. Public opinion and approval ratings: Biden's approval ratings have been fluctuating, but a dramatic decline could potentially influence his decision. 5. Party support: The Democratic Party has generally rallied behind Biden, and there's no clear alternative candidate with widespread support. 6. Time frame: The question's resolution date is very close to the Democratic National Convention (typically held in July or August), making a last-minute withdrawal unlikely. 7. Previous statements: Biden and his team have consistently expressed his intention to run for re-election. 8. Potential for unexpected events: While unlikely, unforeseen circumstances such as a sudden health issue could prompt a withdrawal. Given these factors, it seems highly improbable that Biden would announce he won't accept the nomination at this late stage. He has been actively campaigning, and the party has been preparing for his nomination. A last-minute withdrawal would be extremely disruptive to the Democratic Party's election strategy. The only scenarios where this might occur would be due to a sudden, severe health issue or an unforeseen scandal of significant magnitude. However, these are low-probability events.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

metadata.background_info:
In US politics a brokered convention is [defined as](https://www.brookings.edu/articles/what-is-a-brokered-convention-what-is-a-contested-convention/) a nominating convention in which no candidate has won a majority of the votes in the first round of voting by the delegates. In the 19th Century, brokered conventions were quite common. However, in the 31 presidential elections since the turn of the 20th Century, the Democratic Party has had 5 brokered conventions: | Year | Number of ballots | Nominee | |------|-------------------|--------------------------------| | 1952 | 3 | Adlai Stevenson | | 1932 | 4 | Franklin D. Roosevelt | | 1924 | 103 | John Davis | | 1920 | 44 | James Cox | | 1912 | 46 | Woodrow Wilson | On paper, one might argue that President Joe Biden should be able to fairly easily avoid a brokered convention due to winning 99% of [pledged delegates](https://www.usatoday.com/elections/results/2024/presidential-delegates). Additionally, the Democratic Party's [current plan](https://sourcenm.com/2024/06/24/dnc-moves-ahead-on-all-virtual-roll-call-for-biden-presidential-nomination/) is to hold its roll call virtually, before the in-person Convention and before Ohio's August 7th ballot deadline. However, following Biden's debate with Donald Trump on June 28, 2024, which the New York Times described as "[disastrous](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/06/30/us/politics/biden-debate-anxious-democrats.html)," there was a widespread "freak out" among Democrats [according to Politico](https://archive.ph/mhK7S), which reported that "One prominent operative texted, 'Time for an open convention.'" There were calls for Biden to bow out of the race, for example the NY Times [Editorial Board](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/06/28/opinion/biden-election-debate-trump.html) and influential columnist [Thomas Friedman](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/06/28/opinion/joe-biden-tom-friedman.html). However, as of June 30, 2024, prominent Democrats continued to publicly stand behind Biden, such as former President [Barack Obama](https://www.axios.com/2024/06/28/obama-rescue-biden-calm-nervous-democrats-2024-election) and Congressman [James E. Clyburn](https://thehill.com/homenews/house/4746240-clyburn-biden-debate/). Initial polling after the debate [found](https://www.forbes.com/sites/brianbushard/2024/06/29/warning-signs-for-biden-post-debate-polls-show-more-voters-worried-about-bidens-fitness-but-race-still-virtually-tied/) that increasing numbers of voters believe Biden should drop out. On June 26, 2024 , the day before the debate, Biden was behind Trump by 0.1 in the [538 polling averages](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/). On June 30th, following several post-debate polls, Biden's deficit swelled to 1.3 points. See Also Pew Research: [Contested presidential conventions, and why parties try to avoid them](https://www.pewresearch.org/short-reads/2016/02/04/contested-presidential-conventions-and-why-parties-try-to-avoid-them/)
US News & World Report: [What Is an Open Convention and Why Do Some Democrats Want One?](https://www.usnews.com/news/national-news/articles/2024-06-28/what-is-an-open-convention-and-why-do-some-democrats-want-one)
Wikipedia: [Brokered convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brokered_convention)
The Atlantic: [The Biden-Replacement Operation](https://www.theatlantic.com/politics/archive/2024/06/great-democratic-conundrum-biden/678830/)

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of a brokered convention for the Democrats in 2024, we need to consider several factors: 1. Incumbent advantage: Joe Biden is the incumbent president and the presumptive nominee for the Democratic Party. Historically, incumbent presidents rarely face significant challenges within their own party. 2. Current political landscape: As of the question's creation date (July 8, 2024), there have been no major challengers to Biden's nomination that have gained significant traction. 3. Party unity: The Democratic Party has generally shown unity behind Biden, with most prominent party figures endorsing his re-election bid. 4. Delegate allocation rules: The Democratic Party's proportional allocation of delegates makes it easier for a front-runner to secure the nomination before the convention. 5. Time frame: The resolution date (August 6, 2024) is very close to when the Democratic National Convention would typically be held, leaving little time for a competitive primary process to unfold. 6. Historical precedent: Brokered conventions are extremely rare in modern American politics. The last truly brokered convention for either major party was in 1952. 7. Biden's performance and approval ratings: While these factors could potentially influence the likelihood of a challenge, they would need to be extremely poor to prompt a serious last-minute contest. Given these factors, it is highly unlikely that the Democrats will have a brokered convention in 2024. The combination of Biden's incumbent status, the lack of significant challengers, party unity, and the historical rarity of brokered conventions all point towards a straightforward nomination process. The only scenario where a brokered convention might occur would be if there was a sudden, major event that dramatically altered the political landscape (e.g., a severe health crisis for Biden or a major scandal). However, even in such an unlikely scenario, the party would likely rally around a replacement candidate quickly to avoid a divisive convention.

question.title: Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

metadata.background_info:
[Verisign](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Verisign) operates the authoritative registry for the .com generic top-level domain (TLD) under a registry agreement with the Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers (ICANN) and a [Cooperative Agreement](https://www.ntia.gov/page/verisign-cooperative-agreement) with the US Department of Commerce (DOC). This means it is the wholesale provider of the .com TLD to every domain name registrar. The American Economic Liberties Projected [has called](https://www.economicliberties.us/press-release/ntia-and-doj-must-break-verisigns-monopoly-power-over-domain-names-advocates-urge/) this arrangement a "government-designated monopoly over domain registration." According to [The American Prospect](https://prospect.org/power/2024-06-27-government-created-most-profitable-company-verisign/):

>You have probably never heard of the most profitable company in America, and possibly the world. It’s a government-granted monopoly that feasts on high margins for a low-dollar administrative product. Today, three advocacy groups pressured the Biden administration to take down the rules in place that enable this gravy train.

>The company is called VeriSign [*sic*], and it has exclusive control of the registration system for the .com domain name. Every year, hundreds of millions of website owners pay VeriSign [*sic*] a small annual fee to keep their .com in working order. Every year, the cost of managing the database to make sure that .com websites work either stays flat or goes down, while the fee for registering a .com website goes up.

The Cooperative Agreement between Verisign and the US DOC will automatically renew for a six-year term unless the DOC provides notice of non-renewal on August 2, 2024.

According to [Bloomberg](https://archive.ph/IXZ3V#selection-1705.0-1726.0), during the 2018 renewal the Trump Administration lifted the cap on wholesale prices for *.com*. The antitrust advocacy groups have written to the Justice Department to withdraw guidance that allowed the elimination of price caps in the 2018 renewal, with the letters citing President Biden’s 2021 [executive order](https://www.whitehouse.gov/briefing-room/presidential-actions/2021/07/09/executive-order-on-promoting-competition-in-the-american-economy/) on competition.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of this event occurring, we need to consider several factors: 1. Historical context: Verisign has been managing the .com TLD since 2000, and their agreement with the US government has been renewed multiple times. This suggests a long-standing and stable relationship. 2. Current agreement status: The most recent extension of the agreement between Verisign and the US Department of Commerce was made in 2018, extending Verisign's management of the .com TLD until November 30, 2024. This date is beyond the resolution date of this question (August 3, 2024). 3. Time frame: The question asks about a change occurring before August 3, 2024, which is less than a month from the creation date of the question. Major changes in internet infrastructure typically require significant lead time and planning. 4. Lack of public discussion or controversy: There have been no recent major public discussions or controversies regarding Verisign's management of the .com TLD that would suggest an imminent change. 5. Stability and security concerns: The .com TLD is crucial to the global internet infrastructure. Any change in its management would require careful planning to ensure continued stability and security. Abrupt changes are unlikely. 6. Regulatory environment: While changes in internet governance are possible, they typically involve lengthy processes, public consultations, and international coordination. There's no indication of such a process being underway. 7. Economic factors: Verisign's management of the .com TLD is a significant business arrangement. Any change would likely involve complex negotiations and financial considerations, which are unlikely to be concluded in such a short timeframe. Given these factors, it seems highly unlikely that the US government would end its agreement with Verisign for managing the .com TLD before August 3, 2024. The current agreement extends beyond this date, and there are no visible signs of an impending change. The short timeframe between the question's creation and resolution dates further reduces the likelihood of such a significant change occurring.

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

metadata.background_info:
**Deadpool & Wolverine** is an upcoming blockbuster by Marvel Studios scheduled to be released on July 26, 2024 featuring the two iconic heroes from the X-Men Universe.

The recent projection from Deadline puts the domestic opening to [$160-$165 million](https://deadline.com/2024/07/deadpool-wolverine-box-office-opening-projection-1236000799/), which would not only be the best opening year-to-date (beating **Inside Out 2** with $154 million) but also a record start for an R-rated movie. 

Another projection from June was even higher, [at $200+ million](https://deadline.com/2024/06/deadpool-wolverine-box-office-projection-1235973545/).

The ticket seller Fandango [reported on May 21](https://www.gamespot.com/articles/deadpool-and-wolverine-has-strongest-day-one-ticket-pre-sales-in-franchise-history-at-fandango/1100-6523599/) that their ticket pre-sales for the movie were the site's biggest ones in 2024 up to date.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of 'Deadpool & Wolverine' surpassing the combined opening box office of 'Deadpool' and 'The Wolverine,' we need to consider several factors: 1. Franchise popularity: Both Deadpool and Wolverine are extremely popular characters in the Marvel universe, with dedicated fan bases. 2. Previous performance: 'Deadpool' (2016) had a strong opening of $132,434,639; 'The Wolverine' (2013) opened with $53,113,752; the combined target to beat is $185,548,391. 3. Crossover appeal: Combining these two characters is likely to attract fans of both, potentially expanding the audience beyond what either could achieve individually. 4. Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) integration: This film is expected to be part of the MCU, which could broaden its appeal to general Marvel fans. 5. Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman: Both actors are immensely popular and their on-screen chemistry and off-screen friendship have been widely publicized, adding to the film's appeal. 6. Inflation and ticket prices: Since 2013 and 2016, movie ticket prices have increased, which naturally inflates box office numbers. 7. Post-pandemic box office recovery: While the movie industry has been recovering, there's still some uncertainty about audience behavior. 8. Competition and release timing: The success will partly depend on what other films are released around the same time and the specific release date chosen. 9. Marketing push: Given the high-profile nature of this film, it's likely to receive a significant marketing budget, increasing awareness and anticipation. 10. R-rating: Like previous Deadpool films, this is likely to be R-rated, which could limit some audience reach but also appeals to the core fan base. Considering these factors, especially the combined star power, the crossover appeal, and the integration into the MCU, it seems highly likely that 'Deadpool & Wolverine' will surpass the combined opening weekend of its predecessors. The target of $185,548,391 is substantial, but given the increased ticket prices and the heightened anticipation for this film, it appears achievable. However, there's always some uncertainty in box office predictions, and factors like competition, release date, and overall market conditions at the time of release could impact the outcome.

question.title: On July 17, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if, on July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

metadata.background_info:
Since late 2022, Nvidia Corporation has experienced nearly 10x growth in market capitalization, driven by its [dominance in the AI chip market](https://finance.yahoo.com/news/nvidias-ai-chip-dominance-continue-210200974.html). Nvidia's GPUs are critical in the development of large language models, and are highly sought after by major tech companies like OpenAI, Microsoft, Amazon, and Alphabet.

On May 22nd, Nvidia released [impressive Q1 financial results](https://nvidianews.nvidia.com/news/nvidia-announces-financial-results-for-first-quarter-fiscal-2025#:~:text=NVIDIA%20(NASDAQ%3A%20NVDA)%20today,262%25%20from%20a%20year%20ago.) and simultaneously announced a 10:1 stock split and increase to its dividend, sending its stock price to new all-time highs.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To answer this question, we need to consider several factors: 1. Current market capitalization: As of July 2023, Apple's market cap is around $3 trillion, while Nvidia's is around $1 trillion. This means Nvidia would need to nearly triple its market cap while Apple's remains stable, or Nvidia would need to grow significantly while Apple's decreases. 2. Growth potential: Nvidia is at the forefront of AI and GPU technology, which are rapidly growing fields. The company has seen explosive growth in recent years due to the AI boom. However, Apple is a more diversified company with a strong ecosystem and brand loyalty. 3. Market trends: The tech sector, especially AI-related companies, has been experiencing significant growth. This trend could continue, benefiting Nvidia more than Apple. 4. Time frame: The question is about the situation roughly one year from now. This is a relatively short time for such a significant market cap shift, but not impossible given recent tech sector volatility. 5. Economic factors: Global economic conditions, regulatory changes, and technological advancements could impact both companies differently. 6. Historical precedent: While rapid changes in market cap rankings do occur, displacing the top company (especially one as established as Apple) is rare. Given these factors, while Nvidia has strong growth potential, overtaking Apple's market cap in just one year seems unlikely. Apple's diverse product line, strong brand, and massive cash reserves provide significant stability. For Nvidia to surpass Apple, it would require both exceptional growth from Nvidia and a significant downturn for Apple. However, the AI sector's rapid growth and Nvidia's central position in it do provide a non-negligible chance of this occurring. The probability is low, but not insignificant.

question.title:
Will the  CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS)	
 be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

metadata.background_info: According to [FRED](https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS): > Chicago Board Options Exchange, CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index [VXVCLS], retrieved from FRED, Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis

metadata.chain_of_thought: To answer this question, we need to consider several factors that influence market volatility and compare the current situation with potential future scenarios. Current volatility: As of July 2023, the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) is relatively low compared to historical averages. This suggests that the market is currently experiencing a period of relative calm. Economic cycle: By July 2024, we will be further along in the economic cycle. Typically, as we progress through an economic cycle, the likelihood of increased volatility rises, especially if we're approaching a potential recession or economic downturn. Geopolitical events: Unforeseen geopolitical events can significantly impact market volatility. While we can't predict specific events, the probability of such occurrences increases over time. Monetary policy: The Federal Reserve's actions regarding interest rates and monetary policy can greatly influence market volatility. If the Fed continues to adjust rates or implement new policies, this could lead to increased volatility. Market valuations: If market valuations continue to rise over the next year, there may be increased concern about a potential market correction, which could lead to higher volatility. Technological disruptions: Rapid technological advancements and their impact on various industries can create uncertainty and potentially increase market volatility. question.title: Will the Prime Minister of France belong to the Together coalition on July 30, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

metadata.background_info:
After a far-right victory in the European elections, French President Emmanuel Macron dissolved the National Assembly, calling snap elections for June 30th and July 7th.

The majority of the 577 districts will [see a runoff](https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/french-election-run-off-how-does-it-work-what-look-out-2024-07-05/) on Sunday, July 7, with the most common set of qualified parties being the National Rally-led Union of the Far-Right, centrist Together, and left and center-left New Popular Front. The unprecedented number of three-way runoffs (including *four*-ways in five districts) was boosted by strong turnout, [nearly 20 percentage points more than in 2022](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/strong-turnout-france-high-stakes-elections-support-far-right-grows/); but Together and the NPF guided their third-placed candidates to withdraw to improve the other's chances to beat the far-right, mostly represented by Marine Le Pen's National Rally.

Once the runoff numbers are known for the 17th National Assembly, the question becomes: who will be Prime Minister? The French semi-presidential system gives President Macron political responsibilities, in particular in foreign policy, regardless of the makeup of Parliament; but he must also nominate a Prime Minister, who conducts domestic policy. The government does not need a positive confidence vote from legislators, but it could be subject to a vote of no confidence; current Prime Minister Gabriel Attal's minority government has been relying on case-by-case deals to get legislation approved.

While the far-right has already elected 38 Deputies and made it to the runoff almost everywhere, its surge might still be forestalled by the strategic pact between the center and the left.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To answer this question, we need to consider several factors: 1. Current situation: As of July 2023, the Prime Minister of France is Elisabeth Borne, who belongs to the Renaissance party, which is part of the Together (Ensemble) coalition. 2. Political stability: France has a history of relatively frequent changes in prime ministers, especially when the president faces challenges or seeks to refresh their government. 3. Upcoming events: There are no scheduled elections between now and July 2024 that would directly impact the prime minister's position. 4. President Macron's term: Emmanuel Macron's second term as president runs until 2027, and he has the power to appoint and dismiss prime ministers. 5. Political landscape: The Together coalition, while facing challenges, remains the largest political force in the National Assembly. 6. Time frame: The question asks about the situation on July 30, 2024, which is about a year from now. A lot can change in politics within a year, but major shifts are not guaranteed. Given these factors, there's a good chance that the Prime Minister on July 30, 2024, will still belong to the Together coalition. The coalition represents President Macron's political base, and it's in his interest to maintain a prime minister from this group to ensure policy alignment and political support. However, there are potential risks to this prediction: - If Macron faces significant political challenges, he might reshuffle his government and potentially choose a prime minister from outside the coalition to broaden his support base. - Internal conflicts within the Together coalition could lead to a breakup, although this seems less likely. - Unforeseen political crises could force changes in leadership. Considering all these factors, while there's a strong possibility that the Prime Minister will belong to the Together coalition on the specified date, it's not a certainty.

Trend in Olympic performances: Olympic records are not broken in every Games. The last time the 100m Olympic record was broken was in 2012. 4. Given these factors, it seems unlikely that the Olympic record will be broken in 2024. While it's not impossible, the current state of men's sprinting suggests that times below 9.63 seconds are extremely rare and exceptional. The trend in recent years has been for winning times to be in the 9.80-9.90 range, which is significantly slower than the record.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

metadata.background_info:
On June 27, 2024, Joe Biden and Donald Trump held their first debate as part of the campaign for the 2024 presidential election. Biden's debate performance was [widely seen as poor](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/biden-trump-june-debate-poll/), and prompted calls for Biden to drop out, including [from the New York Times editorial board](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/06/28/opinion/biden-election-debate-trump.html) and, as of July 5, [three House Democrats](https://thehill.com/homenews/house/4755497-seth-moulton-biden-presidential-race/).

The Biden team has reportedly been [taking action](https://www.cnn.com/2024/07/04/politics/biden-rising-tide-pressure-reelection-bid-analysis/index.html) to reverse recent perceptions, and has [so far insisted](https://thehill.com/homenews/campaign/4754840-biden-campaign-denies-dropout-rumors/) that Biden will not be dropping out. However, the New York Times [reported](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/07/03/us/politics/biden-withdraw-election-debate.html) that the Biden team has internally acknowledged that they must turn perceptions around quickly.

According to [538's presidential polling average](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) (when accessed on July 5, 2024), on the date of the debate Trump held a +0.2 percentage point lead in the polling averages, which has since widened to a +2.4 percentage point lead for Trump reported for July 5. The near-term polling trend may be critical as Biden weighs whether to stay in the race ahead of the [2024 Democratic National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_Democratic_National_Convention), which is scheduled to be held August 19th through the 22nd.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To answer this question, we need to consider several factors that could influence the polling average between Donald Trump and Joe Biden on July 15, 2024: 1. Current trends: As of July 5, 2024, Trump is leading Biden by 2.4 points. This is within the range we're looking at (between 2 and 3 points), but there's still time for changes. 2. Time frame: We're looking at a prediction for about 10 days in the future from the current data point. In political polling, this is a relatively short time, but shifts can still occur. 3. Historical volatility: Presidential polling averages tend to fluctuate, but major shifts usually require significant events or developments. 4. Campaign activities: Both candidates are likely to be actively campaigning, which could influence polls. 5. External factors: Unforeseen events (economic changes, international incidents, scandals) could impact polling. 6. Polling methodology: 538's polling average is generally considered reliable and stable, reducing the likelihood of dramatic swings without cause. 7. Election proximity: As we get closer to the election (November 2024), polls tend to become more stable and accurate. Given that Trump is already leading by 2.4 points, and considering the relatively short timeframe, it's quite possible that his lead could remain within the 2 to 3 point range. However, there's also a significant chance it could fall below 2 or rise above 3. The current lead being so close to the target range increases the likelihood of the condition being met. However, the range is quite narrow (only 1 percentage point), which decreases the probability. Balancing these factors, I would estimate there's a moderate chance of Trump's lead falling exactly within this range on the specific date.

question.title: At the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024, will the men's 100m dash winning time break the Olympic record of 9.63s?
question.body: This question resolves as Yes if the winning time of the men's 100m race is less than 9.63s.

metadata.background_info: Usain Bolt's 9.63s Olympic record has stood since the 2012 London Olympics. Will it be broken in Paris 2024?

metadata.chain_of_thought: To answer this question, we need to consider several factors: 1. Current Olympic record: The current Olympic record for the men's 100m dash is 9.63 seconds, set by Usain Bolt in 2012 at the London Olympics. 2. World record: The current world record is 9.58 seconds, also set by Usain Bolt in 2009. This shows that faster times are possible. 3. Recent performances: In recent years, no athlete has consistently run times close to 9.63 seconds. The fastest time in 2023 was 9.83 seconds by Noah Lyles. 4. Technological advancements: Improvements in track surfaces, starting blocks, and shoe technology could potentially lead to faster times. 5. Athlete development: New talents may emerge by 2024, but it's unlikely that they would immediately break such a strong record. 6. Rarity of record-breaking performances: Olympic records are not broken frequently, especially in sprint events where margins are very small. 7. Pressure and conditions: Olympic finals are high-pressure situations, and weather conditions can affect performance. 8. Time until the event: The Olympics are about a year away, which is not a lot of time for significant improvements in human performance. Given these factors, it seems unlikely that the Olympic record will be broken in 2024. While it's not impossible, the current crop of sprinters has not shown consistent performances close to the 9.63-second mark. The record set by Usain Bolt was exceptional, and it may take more time for athletes to reach that level consistently.

question.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win ≥15 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 15 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No".

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 15 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

metadata.background_info:
As per the Olympic Committee’s [recommendations](https://olympics.com/ioc/news/strict-eligibility-conditions-in-place-as-ioc-eb-approves-individual-neutral-athletes-ains-for-the-olympic-games-paris-2024) from earlier this year, Russian and Belarusian athletes will be allowed to participate in the 2024 Games as long as they do so as so-called "Individual Neutral Athletes" (AINs), without an accompanying national flag or anthem.

The Russian Federation/Russian Olympic Committee has won an average of 19 gold medals in the last 3 Olympic Games, and Belarus has averaged  1.7.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of Individual Neutral Athletes (INAs) winning 15 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics, we need to consider several factors: 1. Historical performance: In the 2020 Tokyo Olympics (held in 2021), Russian athletes competing as the Russian Olympic Committee (ROC) won 20 gold medals. This suggests that Russian athletes, who are likely to make up a significant portion of INAs, have the potential to win a substantial number of gold medals. 2. Participation restrictions: The International Olympic Committee (IOC) has allowed Russian and Belarusian athletes to compete as neutral athletes, but with certain restrictions. This may limit the number of athletes participating and potentially reduce their chances of winning medals. 3. Competition in specific sports: Russian athletes have traditionally been strong in sports like gymnastics, wrestling, and swimming. Their performance in these events could significantly impact the total gold medal count for INAs. 4. Preparation and training: The uncertainty surrounding their participation and the potential lack of international competition due to sanctions may have affected the preparation of some athletes, potentially impacting their performance. 5. Motivation: Athletes competing as INAs may be highly motivated to prove themselves on the international stage, which could lead to strong performances. 6. Time frame: The market resolves on August 11, 2024, which is the last day of the Paris Olympics. This gives INAs the full duration of the Games to accumulate gold medals. 7. Comparison to previous Olympics: In the 2016 Rio Olympics, Russia (not as neutral athletes) won 19 gold medals. In 2012 London, they won 24 gold medals. This historical data suggests that reaching 15 gold medals is within the realm of possibility for INAs, assuming a significant portion are Russian athletes. Given these factors, I believe there is a reasonable chance that INAs could win 15 or more gold medals. However, the restrictions and potential reduction in the number of participating athletes compared to previous Olympics make it less likely than in past Games where Russia competed as a nation.

question.title: On July 21, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 75k and less than or equal to 76k?
question.body: This question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

metadata.background_info:
The [Bombay Stock Exchange Sensitive Index](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BSE_SENSEX), also known as the S&P BSE SENSEX or simply the SENSEX, is a stock market index consisting of 30 of the largest companies listed on the Bombay Stock Exchange. It is one of the oldest and most widely followed equity indices in India. The SENSEX is intended to reflect the overall performance of the Indian stock market.

India's recent general elections saw incumbent Prime Minister Narendra Modi's party, the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), win a [narrower victory](https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/india-election-modi-bjp-lost-majority-election-surprise-rcna155557) than expected, raising concerns about potential policy paralysis and the ability of the government to implement key economic reforms. As a result, in the immediate aftermath of the elections, the SENSEX has experienced significant volatility, beginning with a [drop of almost 6%](https://www.aljazeera.com/economy/2024/6/5/india-election-why-modis-narrow-win-has-the-stock-market-in-a-spin) on June 4th, followed by a significant bounce on June 5th.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To answer this question, we need to consider several factors: 1. Current value: As of July 2023, the BSE SENSEX is trading around 65,000-66,000 points. To reach the 75,000-76,000 range by July 2024, it would need to increase by approximately 15% in a year. 2. Historical performance: The SENSEX has shown strong growth over the past decades. In some years, it has grown by more than 15%, but such growth is not guaranteed every year. 3. Economic factors: India's economy is one of the fastest-growing major economies. Continued economic growth could support a rise in the SENSEX. 4. Global economic conditions: Global economic factors, including potential recessions in major economies, could impact Indian markets. 5. Political stability: India's political environment and any major policy changes could influence market sentiment. 6. Specific date: The question asks about July 21, 2024, which is a Sunday. Stock markets are typically closed on Sundays, so we would likely be looking at the closing value from the previous trading day. 7. Narrow range: The question specifies a narrow 1,000-point range (75,000 to 76,000), which makes it less likely to be precisely in this range. Given these factors, while it's possible for the SENSEX to reach the 75,000-76,000 range by July 2024, it's not highly probable. The market would need to grow significantly but not too much to fall within this specific range. The narrow range makes it even less likely.

question.title: Will Kalenjin athletes win both the men's and women's marathon races at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both the winner of the men's and winner's marathon at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris have Kalenjin roots.

metadata.background_info: The Kalenjin people, native to Kenya, dominate racing in distances 800m and longer. Will they win both the men's and women's marathon at the 2024 Paris Olympics?

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of Kalenjin athletes winning both the men's and women's marathon races at the 2024 Paris Olympics, we need to consider several factors: 1. Historical dominance: Kalenjin athletes, particularly those from Kenya, have dominated long-distance running, including marathons, for decades. They have consistently performed exceptionally well in Olympic marathons. 2. Recent performances: In the 2020 Tokyo Olympics (held in 2021), Kenyan athletes (many of whom are Kalenjin) won gold in both the men's and women's marathons. Eliud Kipchoge and Peres Jepchirchir, both Kalenjin, were the winners. 3. Genetic and environmental factors: The Kalenjin people are known for their running prowess, which is attributed to a combination of genetic predisposition, high-altitude training, and a culture that emphasizes running. 4. Competition: While Kalenjin athletes are strong contenders, they face tough competition from other East African runners (e.g., Ethiopians) and athletes from other parts of the world who have been improving their marathon performances. 5. Unpredictability of marathons: Marathon races can be unpredictable due to factors like weather conditions, course difficulty, and individual athlete performance on the day. 6. Time until the event: The Olympics are about a year away from the creation date of this question, which allows for potential changes in the competitive landscape, injuries, or emergence of new talents. 7. Double win requirement: The question requires both men's and women's races to be won by Kalenjin athletes, which increases the difficulty of achieving a 'Yes' resolution. Given these factors, I believe there is a strong chance of Kalenjin athletes winning both marathons, but it's far from certain. Their historical dominance and recent success give them an edge, but the requirement for wins in both races and the potential for upsets or strong performances from non-Kalenjin athletes temper the probability.

question.title: Between July 17 and July 28, 2024, will the strongest geomagnetic storm have a K-index ("Kp") greater than 5 and less than or equal to 6?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 5 and less than or equal to 6, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

metadata.background_info:
In May 2024, sunspot region AR3664, now designated as AR3697, returned to face Earth after merging with another active sunspot region, resulting in numerous M- and X-class solar flares that caused intense [geomagnetic storms and auroras](https://earthsky.org/earth/auroras-last-night-extreme-solar-storm-wow-millions-may-10-11-12-2024/) visible at unusually low latitudes. 

As AR3697 [returns to face Earth](https://www.space.com/return-aurora-causing-sunspot-june-solar-storm-prospects) in early June 2024, space weather forecasters anticipate ongoing geomagnetic activity and are closely monitoring the region's continued potential to produce extreme space weather. 

[Sunspots](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sunspot) are areas of intense magnetic activity that often give rise to solar flares and coronal mass ejections (CMEs), which can disturb Earth's magnetosphere and impact satellite operations, power grids, and navigation systems.

The [K-index](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/K-index), which measures fluctuations in Earth's magnetic field, ranges from from 0 to 9. The NOAA Space Weather Scales uses the Kp values to classify the severity of geomagnetic storms from G1 (minor) to G5 (extreme), equating to Kp values of 5 to 9, respectively.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To answer this question, we need to consider several factors: 1. Historical data: Geomagnetic storms with a K-index between 5 and 6 are considered moderate storms. These occur with some regularity but are not extremely common. 2. Solar cycle: The sun follows an approximately 11-year cycle of activity. As of 2023, we are approaching a solar maximum, which is expected to peak around 2024-2025. This increases the likelihood of solar events that can cause geomagnetic storms. 3. Time frame: The question asks about a specific 12-day period in July 2024, which is likely to be during or near the solar maximum. 4. Seasonal effects: Geomagnetic storms are slightly more common around the equinoxes (March and September) due to the Earth's axial tilt relative to the sun. July is not typically a peak month for geomagnetic activity. 5. Unpredictability: While we can make educated guesses based on solar cycle and historical data, specific geomagnetic events are difficult to predict far in advance. 6. Specificity of the question: The question asks for a very specific range (Kp > 5 and ≤ 6), which narrows the probability compared to asking about any storm above a certain threshold. Given these factors, I believe there is a moderate chance of seeing a geomagnetic storm in the specified range during this period. The approaching solar maximum increases the likelihood, but the specific Kp range and the relatively short time frame (12 days) limit the probability.

question.title: Between July 17 and July 28, 2024, will the strongest geomagnetic storm have a K-index ("Kp") greater than 4 and less than or equal to 5?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 4 and less than or equal to 5, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

metadata.background_info:
In May 2024, sunspot region AR3664, now designated as AR3697, returned to face Earth after merging with another active sunspot region, resulting in numerous M- and X-class solar flares that caused intense [geomagnetic storms and auroras](https://earthsky.org/earth/auroras-last-night-extreme-solar-storm-wow-millions-may-10-11-12-2024/) visible at unusually low latitudes. 

As AR3697 [returns to face Earth](https://www.space.com/return-aurora-causing-sunspot-june-solar-storm-prospects) in early June 2024, space weather forecasters anticipate ongoing geomagnetic activity and are closely monitoring the region's continued potential to produce extreme space weather. 

[Sunspots](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sunspot) are areas of intense magnetic activity that often give rise to solar flares and coronal mass ejections (CMEs), which can disturb Earth's magnetosphere and impact satellite operations, power grids, and navigation systems.

The [K-index](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/K-index), which measures fluctuations in Earth's magnetic field, ranges from from 0 to 9. The NOAA Space Weather Scales uses the Kp values to classify the severity of geomagnetic storms from G1 (minor) to G5 (extreme), equating to Kp values of 5 to 9, respectively.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To answer this question, we need to consider several factors: Historical data indicates that geomagnetic storms with a K-index between 4 and 5 are relatively common, especially during periods of increased solar activity. As of 2023, we are approaching the peak of Solar Cycle 25, expected around 2024-2025, suggesting that solar activity will likely be high during July 2024. The specified 12-day period increases the likelihood of capturing a minor storm. July is also during the northern hemisphere summer, which can contribute to geomagnetic activity. However, the unpredictability of space weather and the specific Kp range requested narrow the certainty. Overall, considering the solar cycle and historical patterns, I estimate a moderate to good chance of a storm in this Kp range during the specified period.

question.title: Between July 17 and July 28, 2024, will the strongest geomagnetic storm have a K-index ("Kp") greater than 4 and less than or equal to 6?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 4 and less than or equal to 6, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

metadata.background_info:
In May 2024, sunspot region AR3664, now designated as AR3697, returned to face Earth after merging with another active sunspot region, resulting in numerous M- and X-class solar flares that caused intense [geomagnetic storms and auroras](https://earthsky.org/earth/auroras-last-night-extreme-solar-storm-wow-millions-may-10-11-12-2024/) visible at unusually low latitudes. 

As AR3697 [returns to face Earth](https://www.space.com/return-aurora-causing-sunspot-june-solar-storm-prospects) in early June 2024, space weather forecasters anticipate ongoing geomagnetic activity and are closely monitoring the region's continued potential to produce extreme space weather.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To answer this question, we need to consider several factors: 1. Historical data: Geomagnetic storms with a K-index between 4 and 6 are relatively common. They occur during moderate solar activity and are not considered extreme events. 2. Solar cycle: The sun follows an approximately 11-year cycle of activity. As of 2023, we are approaching the peak of Solar Cycle 25, which is expected to reach its maximum around 2024-2025. This means that solar activity will likely be high during the specified period in July 2024. 3. Time frame: The question covers a 12-day period, which is a significant amount of time for solar activity to occur and potentially cause geomagnetic disturbances. 4. Seasonal factors: July is during the northern hemisphere summer, which doesn't have a strong correlation with geomagnetic activity. However, geomagnetic storms can occur at any time of the year. 5. Specificity of the K-index range: The question asks for a K-index greater than 4 and less than or equal to 6, which is a common range for moderate geomagnetic storms. Given these factors, especially considering that we'll be near the peak of the solar cycle in July 2024, there's a good chance of seeing at least one moderate geomagnetic storm during the specified 12-day period. However, it's not guaranteed, as solar activity can be unpredictable. The range of K-index values specified (>4 and ≤6) covers moderate geomagnetic storms, which are more frequent than severe storms but less common than minor disturbances. This range increases the likelihood of a 'Yes' resolution compared to if the question asked about more extreme events. Considering all these factors, I believe there's a higher than average chance of seeing a geomagnetic storm in the specified range during this period, but it's not certain.

question.title: Will a swimmer win the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: The question resolves as **Yes** if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events.

metadata.background_info: A few Olympic sports - swimming, athletics, gymnastics - have athletes competing in multiple events. Will the athlete winning the most gold medals at the 2024 Games in Paris be someone competing in the swimming events?

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of a swimmer winning the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics, we need to consider several factors: 1. Historical performance: Swimmers, particularly in recent Olympics, have often been among the top medal winners. Michael Phelps, the most decorated Olympian of all time, was a swimmer. This trend suggests a strong possibility for swimmers to dominate again. 2. Number of events: Swimming has a large number of events in the Olympics, including various distances and strokes for both individual and relay races. This provides more opportunities for swimmers to win multiple medals compared to many other sports. 3. Dominance of certain swimmers: Currently, there are exceptional swimmers like Caeleb Dressel (USA) and Emma McKeon (Australia) who have shown the ability to win multiple gold medals in a single Olympics. 4. Competition from other sports: Track and field athletes, particularly sprinters and distance runners, can also win multiple gold medals. Gymnasts occasionally dominate as well, but they typically have fewer events to compete in compared to swimmers. 5. Team sports: While team sports like basketball or soccer can only win one gold medal per gender, reducing competition for the most golds by an individual. 6. Recent trends: In the 2020 Tokyo Olympics (held in 2021), Caeleb Dressel (swimming) won 5 gold medals, tying for the most with Emma McKeon (also swimming). This recent dominance by swimmers is a strong indicator for 2024. 7. Training cycles: Swimming is a sport where athletes can often maintain peak performance over multiple Olympics, allowing for continued dominance. 8. Potential for new talents: Swimming is a globally popular sport with strong developmental programs in many countries, increasing the chances of new exceptional talents emerging. Given these factors, especially the recent dominance of swimmers in the medal count, the large number of swimming events, and the historical precedent, it seems highly likely that a swimmer will win the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

question.title: Will the Olympic record for the men's pole vault be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the winning height of the men's pole vault at the 2024 Paris Olympics is 6.04m or higher.

metadata.background_info:
Brazilian pole vaulter Thiago Braz set the Olympic record at 6.03m at the 2016 Rio de Janeiro Olympics. Since then, the world record has risen to 6.24m, set by Swedish athlete Armand Duplantis earlier in 2024.

With Braz suspended from the current Games, will his record be broken Duplantis or another competitor?

metadata.chain_of_thought: To answer this question, we need to consider several factors: 1. Current Olympic record: The current Olympic record for men's pole vault is 6.03m, set by Thiago Braz of Brazil at the 2016 Rio Olympics. 2. World record: The current world record is 6.22m, set by Armand Duplantis of Sweden in 2023. This shows that heights above 6.04m are achievable. 3. Recent performances: Armand Duplantis has consistently been clearing heights above 6.04m in recent years. He has cleared 6.05m or higher multiple times in competition. 4. Competition level: The men's pole vault field is currently very strong, with several athletes capable of clearing 6m or higher. 5. Duplantis's dominance: Armand Duplantis is the clear favorite for the 2024 Olympics and has shown the ability to perform well under pressure in major championships. 6. Motivation: Olympic records are highly prestigious, and athletes often push themselves to peak performance at the Olympics. 7. Technological advancements: Improvements in pole technology and training methods could contribute to higher jumps. 8. Weather conditions: Favorable weather conditions in Paris during the event could positively impact performances. However, we must also consider: 9. Pressure of the Olympics: Some athletes might underperform due to the high-pressure environment. 10. Specific conditions on the day: Unfavorable weather or other unexpected factors could negatively impact performances. Given these factors, especially Duplantis's recent performances and his ability to clear heights well above 6.04m consistently, there is a strong possibility that the Olympic record will be broken. However, it's not a certainty due to the unpredictable nature of sports and the specific conditions on the day of the competition.

question.title: Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

metadata.background_info:
[Verisign](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Verisign) operates the authoritative registry for the .com generic top-level domain (TLD) under a registry agreement with the Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers (ICANN) and a [Cooperative Agreement](https://www.ntia.gov/page/verisign-cooperative-agreement) with the US Department of Commerce (DOC). This means it is the wholesale provider of the .com TLD to every domain name registrar. The American Economic Liberties Projected [has called](https://www.economicliberties.us/press-release/ntia-and-doj-must-break-verisigns-monopoly-power-over-domain-names-advocates-urge/) this arrangement a "government-designated monopoly over domain registration." According to [The American Prospect](https://prospect.org/power/2024-06-27-government-created-most-profitable-company-verisign/):

>You have probably never heard of the most profitable company in America, and possibly the world. It’s a government-granted monopoly that feasts on high margins for a low-dollar administrative product. Today, three advocacy groups pressured the Biden administration to take down the rules in place that enable this gravy train.

>The company is called VeriSign [*sic*], and it has exclusive control of the registration system for the .com domain name. Every year, hundreds of millions of website owners pay VeriSign [*sic*] a small annual fee to keep their .com in working order. Every year, the cost of managing the database to make sure that .com websites work either stays flat or goes down, while the fee for registering a .com website goes up.

The Cooperative Agreement between Verisign and the US DOC will automatically renew for a six-year term unless the DOC provides notice of non-renewal on August 2, 2024.

According to [Bloomberg](https://archive.ph/IXZ3V#selection-1705.0-1726.0), during the 2018 renewal the Trump Administration lifted the cap on wholesale prices for *.com*. The antitrust advocacy groups have written to the Justice Department to withdraw guidance that allowed the elimination of price caps in the 2018 renewal, with the letters citing President Biden’s 2021 [executive order](https://www.whitehouse.gov/briefing-room/presidential-actions/2021/07/09/executive-order-on-promoting-competition-in-the-american-economy/) on competition.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of this event occurring, we need to consider several factors: 1. Historical context: Verisign has been managing the .com TLD since 2000, and their agreement with the US government has been renewed multiple times. This suggests a long-standing, stable relationship. 2. Current agreement: The most recent extension of the Cooperative Agreement between Verisign and the DOC was signed in 2018, extending Verisign's management of the .com TLD until November 30, 2024. This date is beyond the resolution date of this question (August 3, 2024). 3. Regulatory stability: The management of critical internet infrastructure like the .com TLD is typically handled with great care and stability to ensure the continued smooth operation of the internet. Abrupt changes are rare. 4. Time frame: The question asks about a change occurring within approximately two weeks (from the creation date to the resolution date). Such a significant change in internet governance would typically require more time for planning, negotiation, and implementation. 5. Lack of public discussion: As of the question's creation date, there are no widely reported discussions or indications that the US government is considering terminating this agreement prematurely. 6. Technical complexity: Transitioning the management of the .com TLD to a new entity would be a complex technical process that would likely require significant preparation time. 7. Economic implications: Verisign derives a significant portion of its revenue from managing the .com TLD. Any change to this arrangement would have substantial economic implications, which would likely be telegraphed well in advance. Given these factors, it seems highly unlikely that the US government would abruptly end its agreement with Verisign before August 3, 2024. The existing agreement extends beyond this date, and there are no apparent signs of any imminent changes. The stability of internet infrastructure management and the short timeframe make a sudden shift extremely improbable.

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

metadata.background_info:
**Deadpool & Wolverine** is an upcoming blockbuster by Marvel Studios scheduled to be released on July 26, 2024 featuring the two iconic heroes from the X-Men Universe.

The recent projection from Deadline puts the domestic opening to [$160-$165 million](https://deadline.com/2024/07/deadpool-wolverine-box-office-opening-projection-1236000799/), which would not only be the best opening year-to-date (beating **Inside Out 2** with $154 million) but also a record start for an R-rated movie. 

Another projection from June was even higher, [at $200+ million](https://deadline.com/2024/06/deadpool-wolverine-box-office-projection-1235973545/).

The ticket seller Fandango [reported on May 21](https://www.gamespot.com/articles/deadpool-and-wolverine-has-strongest-day-one-ticket-pre-sales-in-franchise-history-at-fandango/1100-6523599/) that their ticket pre-sales for the movie were the site's biggest ones in 2024 up to date.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of 'Deadpool & Wolverine' surpassing the combined opening box office of 'Deadpool' and 'The Wolverine,' we need to consider several factors: 1. Franchise popularity: Both Deadpool and Wolverine are extremely popular characters in the Marvel universe, with dedicated fan bases. Their combination in one film is likely to generate significant excitement. 2. Previous performance: 'Deadpool' had an exceptional opening of $132,434,639, while 'The Wolverine' opened at $53,113,752. The combined target of $185,548,391 is substantial but not unreachable for a highly anticipated film. 3. Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) integration: This film marks Deadpool's entry into the MCU, which could attract a broader audience beyond the fans of individual characters. 4. Star power: Ryan Reynolds (Deadpool) and Hugh Jackman (Wolverine) are major Hollywood stars with strong box office draw. 5. Marketing and hype: Given the popularity of both characters, the marketing campaign is likely to be extensive, building significant hype. 6. Release timing: The film is set to release in July 2024, typically a strong month for blockbusters. 7. Post-pandemic box office recovery: By 2024, the box office is expected to have largely recovered from the pandemic slump, potentially leading to higher numbers for major releases. 8. Inflation: Ticket prices in 2024 will likely be higher than in 2013 and 2016, making it easier to reach higher dollar amounts. 9. R-rating: Like previous Deadpool films, this movie is likely to be R-rated, which could slightly limit its audience compared to other Marvel films. 10. Competition: The success will also depend on other major releases around the same time, which is unknown at this point. Considering these factors, especially the combined star power, MCU integration, and the anticipation for this team-up, it seems highly likely that 'Deadpool & Wolverine' will surpass the combined opening of its predecessors. However, the target is still quite high, and there's always some uncertainty in box office predictions.

question.title: Will at least 24 world records be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or greater.

metadata.background_info:
In the last three Summer Olympics, the number of world records broken was:

London 2012: 32
Rio de Janeiro 2016: 23
Tokyo 2020: 27

In '24, will 24 or more records be broken?

metadata.chain_of_thought: To estimate the probability of at least 24 world records being broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics, we need to consider several factors: 1. Historical data: In the 2020 Tokyo Olympics (held in 2021), 26 world records were broken. In the 2016 Rio Olympics, 27 world records were broken. Technological advancements: As technology in sports equipment, training methods, and performance analysis continues to improve, athletes have better tools to enhance their performance, potentially leading to more record-breaking events. 3. New events: The 2024 Paris Olympics will feature new events like breaking (breakdancing), which could potentially lead to new world records being set in these disciplines. 5. Time since last Olympics: With a standard 3-year gap between Tokyo and Paris (instead of the usual 4 years due to the pandemic), athletes might have had less time to significantly improve their performances. 7. Doping controls: Stricter anti-doping measures might make it more challenging to break records through illegal means, potentially reducing the number of records broken. Considering these factors, it seems likely that the 2024 Paris Olympics will see a similar number of world records broken as in recent Olympics. The historical data suggests that breaking 24 or more world records is quite achievable. However, there's always some uncertainty due to various factors that can influence athletic performance.

question.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as No if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, voleyball and water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

metadata.background_info:
Although most events in the Summer Olympics are contested by individual athletes, or small teams of 2-4, a few have one single larger team representing their entire country. These are:

Association football
Basketball 5×5
Basketball 3×3
Field hockey
Handball
Rugby sevens
Volleyball
Water polo

(Beach volleyball is listed on the source but excluded from the question because two teams from each team can qualify, unlike the other sports.)

Will the women's teams of the same nation win at least two of these sports?

metadata.chain_of_thought: To answer this question, we need to consider several factors: 1. Historical performance: In previous Olympics, it's been common for certain countries to dominate in multiple team sports. For example, the United States has been strong in both basketball and volleyball. 2. Diversity of sports: The eight sports listed are quite diverse, which could lead to different countries excelling in different areas. For instance, field hockey has traditionally been dominated by European and Asian countries, while rugby sevens has seen success from countries like Australia and New Zealand. 3. Global competitiveness: Women's team sports have become increasingly competitive globally, with more countries investing in their programs. This could lead to a more even distribution of medals. 4. Number of sports: With eight different sports, the chances of one country winning multiple golds increases, as opposed to if there were fewer events. 5. Powerhouse nations: Countries like the USA, China, and some European nations often perform well across multiple sports due to their resources and athletic programs. 6. Time frame: The question resolves shortly after the Olympics end, so we will have a definitive answer. Given these factors, I believe it's more likely than not that at least one nation will win more than one women's team sport. The diversity of sports provides multiple opportunities for countries with strong overall athletic programs to excel in more than one area. Additionally, historical patterns suggest that certain countries often perform well across various team sports. However, the increasing global competitiveness in women's sports could lead to more diverse winners, which slightly reduces the probability.

question.title: Will an athlete win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

metadata.background_info: Tennis at the Olympics has five events: singles for men and women, and doubles for men, women and mixed. This makes it possible for the same athlete to win more than one medal. Will it happen?

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of an athlete winning more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics, we need to consider several factors: 1. Tennis events at the Olympics: There are five tennis events - men's singles, women's singles, men's doubles, women's doubles, and mixed doubles. This provides multiple opportunities for athletes to compete and win medals. 2. Historical precedent: In recent Olympic Games, it has been common for top tennis players to win multiple medals. For example: - In Tokyo 2020, Andrey Rublev and Anastasia Pavlyuchenkova won gold in mixed doubles and silver in men's doubles and women's singles respectively. - In Rio 2016, Andy Murray won gold in men's singles and silver in mixed doubles. - In London 2012, Andy Murray won gold in singles and silver in mixed doubles, while Serena Williams won gold in both singles and doubles. 3. Participation in multiple events: Many top players often compete in both singles and doubles events, increasing their chances of winning multiple medals. 4. Strength of top players: Tennis has several dominant players who consistently perform well in major tournaments. These players are likely to participate in the Olympics and have a good chance of winning medals in multiple events. 5. Team strength: Some countries have strong tennis teams, which increases the likelihood of their players winning medals in doubles events in addition to potential singles medals. 6. Short timeframe: The Olympic tennis event takes place over a short period (typically 9 days), which can favor top players who are in good form during that specific time. Given these factors, it seems quite likely that at least one athlete will win more than one medal in tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The historical precedent shows that this has happened in recent Olympics, and the structure of the tennis events provides ample opportunity for it to occur again. However, we must also consider potential factors that could reduce this likelihood: - Injuries or fatigue affecting top players - Upsets in the tournament - Changes in the competitive landscape of tennis by 2024. Despite these potential obstacles, the overall likelihood of an athlete winning multiple medals remains high.

question.title: Will the USA win more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if the United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

metadata.background_info:
The 2024 Olympic Games is a sporting competition which takes place every four years. It involves a range of different events across multiple sports.

At the Olympic Games, Gold, Silver and Bronze medals are awarded to 1st, 2nd and 3rd place in each event. (In some events two Bronze medals are awarded mostly combat sports).

metadata.chain_of_thought: To answer this question, we need to consider several factors: 1. Historical performance: The USA has consistently been one of the top-performing countries at the Olympics. In recent Summer Olympics, they have typically won more gold medals than silver medals. 2. Tokyo 2020 (held in 2021) results: The USA won 39 gold medals and 41 silver medals. This was an unusual occurrence, as it's one of the rare times the US won more silver than gold. 3. Team strength: The USA continues to have a strong team across many sports, particularly in swimming, athletics, and basketball, which are high gold medal-producing events. 4. Competition from other countries: China and ROC (Russian Olympic Committee) are strong competitors, but the USA generally maintains an edge. 5. Home advantage: The USA doesn't have a home advantage in Paris 2024, which could have boosted their gold medal count. 6. Time for preparation: Athletes have had a full Olympic cycle to prepare, unlike the shortened cycle before Tokyo due to the pandemic. 7. Unpredictability of sports: Upsets and unexpected performances can always occur, potentially affecting the medal distribution. Given these factors, I believe the USA is more likely than not to win more gold medals than silver medals in Paris 2024. The Tokyo 2020 result seems to be an anomaly rather than a trend, considering the USA's consistent performance in previous Olympics. The strong team across multiple sports and the full preparation time should contribute to a higher gold medal count. However, the margin might be close, and there's always an element of uncertainty in sports competitions. The probability isn't overwhelmingly high due to the recent Tokyo results and the inherent unpredictability of Olympic performances.

question.title: Will Poland win the 2024 Warhammer 40,000 World Team Championship?
question.body: This question will resolve Yes if Poland is the winner of the WTC 2024 as announced on the official site or the official social media of the organisation.

metadata.background_info:
Warhammer 40,000 is a miniature wargame produced by Games Workshop. Set in the far future, players collect, assemble, and paint miniature figures representing warriors, creatures, and vehicles from various factions. Players then pit their armies against each other on a tabletop battlefield. Warhammer 40,000 is currently the [most popular](https://icv2.com/print/article/56556) miniature wargame in the world.

Each year, the World Team Championship (WTC) is organized, where 8-player teams from around the world compete against each other. The teams are separated into 4 seeding groups based on past performance. In the group stage of the tournament, 10 groups are formed with 4 teams each (one from each seeding group). Group stage performance determines the overall ranking among teams, which then compete in a further 4 games following a [Swiss format](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Swiss-system_tournament). The team with the most total points from the group and Swiss stages is crowned the winner.

This year, the WTC takes place in Mechelen, Belgium from August 8th to 11th. 40 national teams are competing, including 5 first-time competitors: Andorra, China, Mexico, Singapore/Thailand, and South Korea. The full list of teams and seeding groups can be found [here](https://www.facebook.com/photo?fbid=847246644093139). Past performance can be found [here](https://worldteamchampionship.com/about/history/).

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of Poland winning the 2024 Warhammer 40,000 World Team Championship (WTC), we need to consider several factors: 1. Historical performance: Poland's past performance in WTC events would be a crucial indicator. However, without specific information about their previous results, it's difficult to gauge their strength based on history alone. 2. Current competitive landscape: The strength of other national teams, particularly those from countries with strong Warhammer 40k communities like the UK, USA, Germany, or France, would significantly impact Poland's chances. 3. Polish Warhammer 40k community: The size and competitiveness of Poland's Warhammer 40k player base would influence their chances. A larger, more active community increases the likelihood of fielding a strong team. 4. Team selection process: The method used to select the Polish team members could affect their chances. A rigorous selection process would improve their odds. 5. Recent tournament results: Any notable performances by Polish players in major international tournaments leading up to the WTC would be indicative of their current form. 6. Game balance and meta: The current state of the game, including any recent rule changes or popular army compositions, could favor or disfavor the Polish team depending on their preferred playstyles. 7. Time until the event: With the event occurring in August 2024 and the question being asked in July 2024, there's limited time for significant changes in team composition or strategy. Without specific information about Poland's strength in Warhammer 40k or their past performances in similar events, it's challenging to give a high probability of them winning. In international gaming competitions, it's generally difficult for any single country to have a very high likelihood of winning, given the global nature of the competition. Considering these factors and the lack of specific information favoring Poland, I would estimate their chances as relatively low but not negligible. They likely have a competitive team, but so do many other countries.
